meanings.definition: A unit of currency in the wizarding world of Harry Potter.
meanings.sent1: In the wizarding world, you can buy magical items with knuts.
meanings.sent2: Harry Potter exchanged knuts for some Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans.
meanings.sent3: Hermione accidentally turned all her knuts into chocolate coins.
meanings.sent4: The knuts jingled in Hagrid's pocket as he walked through Diagon Alley.
meanings.sent5: The sound of knuts clinking together filled the air at Gringotts Bank.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a foolish or eccentric person.
meanings.sent1: Don't be such a knuts, always getting into trouble.
meanings.sent2: The town eccentric was known as the local knuts.
meanings.sent3: The knuts of the group always had the most outlandish ideas.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a knuts in a world of serious individuals.
meanings.sent5: The knuts in the office always made everyone laugh with their antics.
